revised_title: The Coefficient of Viscosity of Air: A Study of Torsional Vibrations
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine the coefficient of viscosity of air using the method of torsional vibrations of disks. They built an apparatus with a wire suspended in an air chamber and measured the damping of vibrations to calculate the coefficient of viscosity. The results were compared with previous findings, highlighting the importance of controlling factors like temperature and pressure in these experiments.
